club-update = 18:57, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 00:59, 27 March 2017 (UTC) }} '''Henri Gregoire Saivet''' (born 26 October 1990) is a Senegalese professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for Turkish club [[Bursaspor]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. He is a former [[France national youth football team|France youth international]] having starred at several youth levels.
==Career== ===Bordeaux=== In 2007, Saivet signed his first professional contract with Bordeaux, thus making him the youngest professional player in the history of the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11994_4511563,00.html|title=Sky Sports Scout – Henri Saivet|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=25 November 2008|accessdate=23 March 2010}}</ref> He subsequently made his professional debut during the [[2007–08 Ligue 1|2007–08 season]], at the age of 17, in a league match against [[RC Lens|Lens]].
===Newcastle United=== On 11 January 2016, Bordeaux manager [[Willy Sagnol]] confirmed that he gave Saivet permission to leave the club.<ref name="Newcastle and Bordeaux confirm £4.5m Henri Saivet deal is nearly done">{{cite web | url=http://www.eurosport.co.uk/football/premier-league/2015-2016/newcastle-and-bordeaux-confirm-4.5m-henri-saivet-deal-is-nearly-done_sto5055855/story.shtml? | title=Newcastle and Bordeaux confirm £4.5m Henri Saivet deal is nearly done | work=EuroSport | date=11 January 2016 | accessdate=11 January 2016}}</ref> Later that day Saivet officially signed a five-and-half year contract with [[Newcastle United]], joining for a reported fee of £5 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=United Complete Saivet Signing|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20160111/united-complete-saivet-signing_2281670_5266658|website=Newcastle United|accessdate=11 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Newcastle sign midfielder Henri Saivet from Bordeaux|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2784847/newcastle-sign-midfielder-henri-saivet-from-bordeaux|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=12 January 2016|date=11 January 2016}}</ref>
====Saint-Étienne (loan}==== After playing just four matches starting twice in half a season with [[Newcastle United]], Saivet joined [[AS Saint-Étienne]] on a season-long loan on 23 August 2016 without a purchase option given to Saint-Étienne.<ref>{{cite news|title=St Etienne sign Newcastle's Saivet and Villa's Veretout on a season's loan|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37176399|accessdate=24 August 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=24 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Monier|first1=Hugo|title=igue 1 : Saint-Etienne officialise les prêts d'Henri Saivet et Jordan Veretout|url=http://www.francetvsport.fr/football/ligue-1/ligue-1-saint-etienne-officialise-les-prets-d-henri-saivet-et-jordan-veretout-355743|accessdate=24 August 2016|work=France TV Sport|date=24 August 2016|language=French}}</ref>
====Return to Newcastle United==== On 23 August 2017, Saivet played his first game for Newcastle since 6 February 2016 starting an [[EFL Cup]] tie against [[Nottingham Forest]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40944674 |title=Newcastle 2-3 Nottingham Forest |publisher=BBC |date=23 August 2017 |accessdate=1 September 2017}}</ref> He was recalled to the first team on 23 December and scored a free kick in a 3–2 [[Premier League]] win against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Baker|first1=Ian|title=Newcastle end losing run with thrilling victory away at West Ham to ease pressure on Rafa Benitez|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/west-ham-vs-newcastle-rafa-benitez-goals-henri-saivet-mohamed-diame-christian-atsu-a8126596.html|accessdate=24 December 2017|work=The Independent|date=23 December 2017}}</ref>
====Bursaspor (loan)==== On 25 August 2018, it was announced that Saivet will join Turkish club [[Bursaspor]] on loan for the [[2018–19 Süper Lig season|season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45309288|title=Henri Saivet: Newcastle's Senegal international joins Bursaspor on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2018|accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== He made his debut for [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] on August 14, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201308261696.html|title=Senegal: The Magnificent Free Kick of the Senegalese Henri Saivet for Bordeaux|first=Moutakilou|last=Mumuni|date=26 August 2013|publisher=|via=AllAfrica}}</ref>
